thread.title: Texans' training camp moving to West Virginia
thread.title_full: Texans' training camp moving to West Virginia

author: John McClain
title: Texans' training camp moving to West Virginia
text:
Close Image 1 of 5 Houston Texans rookie offensive lineman Chad Slade carries his, Duane Brown's and James Ferentz' pads off the field at the end of practice during Texans training camp at the Methodist Training Center Tuesday, Aug. 11, 2015, in Houston. ( Brett Coomer / Houston Chronicle ) less Houston Texans rookie offensive lineman Chad Slade carries his, Duane Brown's and James Ferentz' pads off the field at the end of practice during Texans training camp at the Methodist Training Center Tuesday, ... more Photo: Brett Coomer, Staff Image 2 of 5 Houston Texans defensive back Robert Nelson (32) breaks up a pass intended for wide receiver Braxton Miller (13) during Texans training camp at Houston Methodist Training Center on Tuesday, Aug. 9, 2016, in Houston. ( Brett Coomer / Houston Chronicle ) Houston Texans wide receiver Wendall Williams (82) returns a punt during Texans training camp at Houston Methodist Training Center on Monday, Aug. 1, 2016, in Houston. ( Brett Coomer / Houston Chronicle ) Photo: Brett Coomer, Staff Image 4 of 5 Houston Texans running back Lamar Miller (26) runs with the football past linebacker Shakeel Rashad (42) after making a catch during Texans training camp at Houston Methodist Training Center on Monday, Aug. 1, 2016, in Houston. ( Brett Coomer / Houston Chronicle ) less Houston Texans running back Lamar Miller (26) runs with the football past linebacker Shakeel Rashad (42) after making a catch during Texans training camp at Houston Methodist Training Center on Monday, Aug. 1, ... more Photo: Brett Coomer, Staff Image 5 of 5 Texans offensive lineman Chad Slade runs a blocking drill during training camp last summer. He has been on the practice squad for two seasons. Texans offensive lineman Chad Slade runs a blocking drill during training camp last summer. He has been on the practice squad for two seasons. Photo: Brett Coomer, Staff Texans' training camp moving to West Virginia 1 / 5 Back to Gallery 
The Texans made it official today that they will move training camp to The Greenbrier at White Sulpur Springs, W.Va. 
Reports surfaced last week that the Texans were planning to replace New Orleans at The Greenbrier. 
This is the first time they will not have camp at their Houston Methodist Training Center across the street from NRG Stadium. 
The dates for training camp and times for practices will be announced later. 
"We are thrilled with the opportunity to hold training camp at the Greenbrier," general manager Rick Smith said in a statement. "It's a wonderful place, and the facilities and climate combine for an ideal environment as our team trains, bonds and prepares for the 2017 season." 
Owner Bob McNair said last week that one reason the Texans were moving to West Virginia is because of better weather. The temperature is a lot cooler than in Houston during training camp in August. 
The Saints were the first team to train at The Greenbrier. They had camp in White Sulphur Springs the last three years. After their contract expired, the Saints didn't renew, and they're expected to move camp back to Louisiana.
